body.p: This document contains information related to the Gentoo Linux 1.4 for x86 Maintenance Release 1, which was built and released on 11 September, 2003. Gentoo Linux 1.4-MR1 is available from our various mirrors in the releases/x86/1.4 directory. The Maintenance Release 1 LiveCDs have build dates of 20030911.

chapter.title: Gentoo Linux 1.4 for x86 MR1 Errata

body.p: This section contains information related to known issues in Gentoo Linux 1.4 for x86 MR1.

If you browse the contents of Disc 1 using an already-running operating system, you will see /install.html and /install.pdf files in the root directory of the CD-ROM. These files contain up-to-date installation instructions for this release. The install.pdf documentation is readable in Acrobat Reader (acroread under Linux) or xpdf. It is also in a compact form that is well-suited for printing before you begin the installation process.

p.e: However, if you boot Disc 1 (rather than browse its contents on an already-installed system,) these files can be found in /mnt/cdrom and can be viewed by typing links /mnt/cdrom/install.html.

body.p: If any application returns a libaspell.so.15 not found message, simply type emerge -k aspell as root to correct this situation. This will allow programs such as gaim to work properly. This problem was caused by a missing runtime dependency in the aspell eclass and is fixed in our "live" Portage tree.
The openoffice-bin package in 1.4 for x86 MR1 does not function properly. We are currently looking into this issue and expect to have openoffice working properly for our next official release.
